1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: Zulu and his pride move one step closer to release. The six lions are darted and moved to their new home. The lions could have a reaction to the drugs and the stakes are raised when the male lions start to wake up on route to their new home!

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Seven new lions arrive at the park and two adult females are brought in to start Zambia?s first breeding programme. At the Dambwa Forest site David checks in with Zulu and his pride to make sure they?re settling in to their new home.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: David oversees a potentially dangerous introduction when 17 month old sisters Temi and Tswana move in with two older females.

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Three of the oldest lions in the Zambian programme set foot in the release site for the first time. When the enclosure gate is opened and the females get the chance to explore their new hunting ground.

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot: When the youngest cubs in the Zambian Programme come face to face with a herd of impala - Bisa sees an opportunity to impress. But later, her confidence is put to the test when her and her sister are introduced to three older cubs.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: When the youngest cubs in the Zambian Programme come face to face with a herd of impala - Bisa sees an opportunity to impress. But later, her confidence is put to the test when her and her sister are introduced to three older cubs.

7.title: Episode #2.7
7.plot: There?s a long awaited reunion when David catches up with 17 month old lions Jebari and Jelani - two cubs he helped raise. After seven months apart the cubs have doubled in size and in confidence and developed skills that David has never seen before!

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: At Antelope Park in central Zimbabwe seven female lions called the Ngamo pride are almost ready for release into a huge semi wild enclosure where it?s hoped they?ll breed.

9.title: Episode #2.9
9.plot: At Antelope Park there?s a gathering of dignitaries from across Zimbabwe, as British Conservationist David Youldon prepares to release seven female lions called the Ngamo pride.

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: Following the release of seven female lions into a huge purpose built enclosure, the team prepares for the dangerous introduction of an adult male to the pride.

11.title: Episode #2.11
11.plot: At Antelope Park in central Zimbabwe, lion expert David Youldon witnesses his youngest cubs make remarkable progress.

12.title: Episode #2.12
12.plot: Lion expert David Youldon is in Zambia, where he witnesses the exceptional hunting skills of the Dambwa pride as they?re prepared for release into a specially built 900 acre enclosure.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Englishman David Youldon is trying to halt the decline in the wild African lion population - it has gone down by nearly 80 percent in the past 50 years.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: David Youldon and the team oversee a potentially dangerous introduction when a two-year-old male is introduced to two older brothers. And some new arrivals enter the reserve.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: David Youldon takes three lionesses on their first night hunt. They must learn to work together - if they do not hunt as a team they will not survive in the wild.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: David Youldon says goodbye to Jabari and Jelani, two six-month-old cubs he has been walking.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: David Youldon travels 300 miles to the Dambwa Forest in Zambia, where he meets the predatory Leya and her lazy brother.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Alpha female Kela, with Kwandi and Loma risk their lives in a breathtaking chase involving two buffalo. And 13-month-old sisters Temi and Tswana go in search of smaller prey.

imdb.title: Lion Country
plot: _Lion Country_ (qv) follows the work of young British lion conservationist David Youldon and his team as he takes lions reared in captivity at his park in Zimbabwe, on a dangerous journey towards independence and possible freedom.
